speaker: NARRATOR
text: Watch what happens this time when the provider cues into what the parent is saying, empathizes with her situation, and attempts to work with the parent to find a solution that fits her needs.

speaker: NARRATOR
text: This time the provider had the same agenda to talk to this parent about the dangers of secondhand smoke and a counsel heard her quit smoking.

speaker: NARRATOR
text: However, this time the provider's focus was on the parent's own view of the issue.

speaker: NARRATOR
text: By giving the parent an opportunity to reflect on her situation the provider was able to elicit reasons for change from the parent herself.

speaker: NARRATOR
text: There was no need to lecture or scold because the parent was making her own case against smoking.

speaker: NARRATOR
text: Many times our patients already have the information that we try to give them.

speaker: NARRATOR
text: What they really need is someone to listen to them and to help them sort out a plan that will fit in their life.

speaker: NARRATOR
text: By accepting and respecting our patients, even with their faults, we communicate our genuine desire to help them make positive changes in their lives.

speaker: NARRATOR
text: During this interaction the provider demonstrated that she understood the parent's struggle and that she still wanted to help.

speaker: NARRATOR
text: As a result, this single parent found she finally had someone on her team.

speaker: NARRATOR
text: This increased both her interest and willingness to try working further with the provider to find a solution that would fit in her life.
